flowitems.name: Map Payment Info
flowitems.description: GPP derives and identifies fundamental payment attributes, for example, Message ID (uniquely identifies message in GPP), Local Office (for across legal entities or countries implementation), Department, Business Area, and Product. The message type of an incoming payment message may Fusion Global PayPlus | Single Payments | Business Guide Page 33 be set using the Inbound Message Type Selection rules, and the payment priority using the Prioritization business rules

flowitems.name: Base Currency Conversion
flowitems.description: GPP converts all payments to a base currency equivalent and calculates the base amount in the local office currency equivalent. This base amount is used in GPP processing in various places in the payment workflow, for example, during account posting, amount validation like foreign exchange thresholds.

flowitems.name: Message Filter
flowitems.description: GPP excludes payments that meet specific rule conditions, which are defined in the Message filter business rule, from being processed at the initial stage in payment processing. For example, the financial institution only processes USD payments, all other currency ayments are stopped (until the filter is removed).

flowitems.name: Source MOP STP Validation
flowitems.description: GPP performs the required validation on the payment, which is based on the source of the payment. For example, for incoming clearing ayments, a system rule can be configured to ensure allowed values are only received in certain fields, defining mandatory fields.

flowitems.name: Compliance Check
flowitems.description: GPP determines whether the payment is compliant as per regulations. GPP can interface with external compliance engines to perform he compliance check.

flowitems.name: Repair and Enrichment
flowitems.description: GPP has the ability to automatically repair payments and enrich specific payment fields by deriving required information, which ncreases STP rates. Payments can be automatically repaired and enriched using the Repair and Enrichment rules, which can derive missing nformation that was not included in the original payment message. GPP can use these rules to do the following: 1. Set values of missing transaction attributes  2. Remove values from transaction attributes 3. Update transaction statuses

flowitems.name: STP Validation
flowitems.description: The STP validation mechanism in GPP provides an ability to apply complex validations and manipulations on the payment.

flowitems.name: Party Details Enrichment
flowitems.description: To enrich the party’s information, GPP identifies and loads relevant account information for the first in chain party. For example, erives local clearing code from BIC.

flowitems.name: Message Duplicate Checking
flowitems.description: Duplicate checking is executed on payments that are either: 1. Received by GPP from external networks (ACH) or internal applications 2. Manually entered or handled by a user Based on the selected algorithm (key message fields such as message type, currency, amount and beneficiary), GPP examines every payment for possible duplication. If a payment is a duplicate, GPP routes the payment to the Dupex queue for manual handling.

flowitems.name: Office SLA
flowitems.description: In the payment processing flow, GPP checks as early as possible whether the payment is associated with a specific Service Level greement (SLA) profile, which defines payment processing constraints. For example, processing the payment by a specific time (EBA priority ayments processed within 90 minutes), SLA for Continuous Linked Settlement (CLS) payments. GPP can alert a user when the SLA is about to be exceeded. When multiple SLAs are defined, than the earliest or most urgent SLA is considered. SLA can be defined at a local office level.

flowitems.name: Incoming Reject Return
flowitems.description: GPP matches incoming reject and return payments with the outward payment processed and reverses the accounting.

flowitems.name: Find 1st in chain
flowitems.description: The transaction source (from where the payment is being sent) can be identified for the first party in the debit chain. This process involves GPP identifying the first party from the parties quoted in the SWIFT payment debit chain. Identification of the debit party can be performed using the BIC, NCC, IBAN or GPP internal customer codes.

flowitems.name: Load Party
flowitems.description: After successful identification of the party, GPP loads the party information from the GPP Parties profile.

flowitems.name: Account Derivation
flowitems.description: GPP derives the relevant accounts (debit account of a credit transfer) either from: Payment Information, Account Profile, External account lookup. The debit account can also be derived in other currencies (other than payment currency) if currency conversion is allowed. GPP can override the account derived automatically with the account assigned by business rules for specific type of payments.

flowitems.name: Debit Authorization
flowitems.description: GPP checks if the sender of the payment is authorized to debit the account which does not belong to the sender.

flowitems.name: Debit Side FX Conversion
flowitems.description: When the debit account currency of the derived debit account is not equal to the payment’s currency, there is a need to perform debit side foreign exchange. GPP supports calculation of debit amount when payment amount is fixed as well as calculation of payment amount when debit amount is fixed (reversal sell).

flowitems.name: Debit Party SLA
flowitems.description: GPP allows specific service level agreements to be defined with the debit party.

flowitems.name: Payment Classification
flowitems.description: GPP assigns the message class to the payment in order to distinguish specific processing needs. For example, the message class PAY indicates that the payment is a normal accounting message, whereas message class NAC indicates that the payment does not require accounting.

flowitems.name: Incoming Risk Management
flowitems.description: Incoming Risk Management covers Private Integrated Services Network (PISN) logic and Liquidity and Risk Management, which is an optional part of the Single Payments Flow invocation.

flowitems.name: Priority
flowitems.description: A financial institution can define the priority (from lowest to extra special with 9 pre-defined priorities) for processing different types of payments in GPP. For example, CLS payments are typically high priority and therefore can be categorized as extra special priority payments. GPP processes the payment based on the defined priority.

flowitems.name: Find 1st in chain
flowitems.description: The credit party can be any of the following: Instructed Agent/Receiver, InstdRmbrsmntAgt/F56-Intermediary Institution, CdtrAgt & CdtrAgtAcct/F57-Account with Institution, Cdtr & CdtrAcct/F58/59-Beneficiary

flowitems.name: Load Party
flowitems.description: After successful identification of the party, GPP loads the party information from the GPP Parties profile.

flowitems.name: Credit Party Chain Enrichment
flowitems.description: Using the credit party chain enrichment process, a financial institution can add a new party to the credit chain or replace an existing party based on the payment attributes.

flowitems.name: Account Derivation
flowitems.description: GPP performs the account derivation either from the payment, Account’s profile, or using an external account lookup (CDB lookup). Credit account can also be derived in other currencies (other than payment currency) when currency conversion is allowed.

flowitems.name: Credit Side FX Conversion
flowitems.description: Once the credit account is derived and if credit account currency is not equal to the payment’s currency, there is a need to perform the credit side FX.

flowitems.name: Credit Party SLA
flowitems.description: GPP allows specific service level agreements to be defined with credit party.

flowitems.name: MOP Selection
flowitems.description: GPP provides the list of pre-defined method of payments (MOP) supported, for example, BOOK, SWIFT, TARGET2, MEPS. The financial institution can define the MOP selection rules for different types of payments based on their payment’s attributes.

flowitems.name: MOP Identifier
flowitems.description: GPP may need to enrich the payment with additional information, for example enrich the payment with NCC from its BIC for payments settled via a clearing that requires NCC. For a clearing MOP (RTGS and low value clearing), GPP needs to identify the settlement account. Using the MOP Identifier’s profile, the settlement account of the local bank (in local bank’s Book) can be defined.

flowitems.name: Message Type Slection
flowitems.description: GPP evaluated the message type selection rule and converts the original message type into a different one depending on the candidate MOP.

flowitems.name: Value Date
flowitems.description: Value date determination is an integral part of MOP selection process. GPP calculates the value date and determines the best MOP with the earliest value date to process the payment.

flowitems.name: Membership Check
flowitems.description: For clearing MOPs (RTGS, and low value), GPP can be configured to validate that the first in credit chain is a direct or indirect member of the clearing system associated with the MOP. If the first in credit chain is an indirect participant then GPP can automatically add its direct participating bank to the credit chain.

flowitems.name: RMA Check
flowitems.description: GPP supports the pre-defined validation rules as per the MOP guidelines for Relationship Management Application (RMA) check. The RMA is a service provided by SWIFT to manage the business relationships between financial institutions.

flowitems.name: MOP Validation
flowitems.description: The Target MOP (also known as credit MOP) is applied only if it passes all the MOP validations. GPP is pre-configured (system configuration) for standard clearing MOP validations for each clearing supported (for example, Max Amount, Min Amount check).

flowitems.name: Building Correspondent Chain
flowitems.description: When no relationship exists with the credit chain party, the financial institution can transfer funds using another financial institution for processing and define the transfer method.

flowitems.name: Debit Transaction Code
flowitems.description: GPP provides rule based mechanism to assign the debit and credit transaction codes. The transaction codes can be set based on various payment attributes, for example, MOP, product code, currency. These transaction codes are used during posting.

flowitems.name: Credit Transaction Code
flowitems.description: GPP provides rule based mechanism to assign the debit and credit transaction codes. The transaction codes can be set based on various payment attributes, for example, MOP, product code, currency. These transaction codes are used during posting.

flowitems.name: Sender Credit Line Replenishment
flowitems.description: When an incoming direct message is processed to Complete by applying the Sender Credit Line, then upon receipt of its cover, the credit line is replenished by the cover amount.

flowitems.name: Prevent STP
flowitems.description: GPP provides a mechanism to attach special instructions to a specific payment. Payments with special instructions attached can be routed to specific manual queues for manual handling. Multiple special instructions can be attached to a single payment.

flowitems.name: Fees
flowitems.description: GPP enables a financial institution to apply fees and charges for each transaction during the transaction processing.

flowitems.name: Hold Until Time
flowitems.description: GPP can process the payment up to fees calculation and hold a particular type of transaction until a pre-defined time during the day. This is performed using the Timed Hold rule. At the selected time, the payment is automatically released from the hold queue and continues to be processed towards completion.

flowitems.name: Balance Inquiry
flowitems.description: GPP provides a standard interface to perform the balance inquiry on debit account before performing the posting step. GPP parks the payment in Wait BI queue until the response is received from the accounting system.

flowitems.name: Stop Flags
flowitems.description: Account stop flag check is performed on the S message account. The stop flag is either received from the balance inquiry response or setup in the Account profile.

flowitems.name: Generate Direct/Cover
flowitems.description: If transfer method of the payment is assigned as Direct/Cover then GPP generate Direct message using Generate Transaction mechanism and convert the existing payment as Cover payment.

flowitems.name: Compliance Check
flowitems.description: GPP performs a compliance request on the payment.

flowitems.name: Warehouse
flowitems.description: Payments whose processing date is not the same as, or later than the office business date are warehoused and moved to the Scheduled queue.

flowitems.name: External FX
flowitems.description: GPP performs currency conversion for the lump sum amount when the payment currency is different than the account currency.

flowitems.name: Liquidity
flowitems.description: In this step, GPP checks the liquidity status for clearing the settlement account.

flowitems.name: Posting (Before Completion)
flowitems.description: GPP triggers the relevant interface to perform the required posting.

flowitems.name: Format Out and Transmission
flowitems.description: GPP generates the out payment.

flowitems.name: Match Response to Payment
flowitems.description: GPP matches the response to the individual payment.

flowitems.name: Posting (Customer Leg)
flowitems.description: GPP performs the customer leg posting. The customer can be debited either in a lump sum or individually for each payment.

flowitems.name: Out Bulk Grouping ID Selection
flowitems.description: GPP invokes Out Bulk Grouping ID Selection rules to determine the group ID - Out data manipulation rule that GPP uses to build the outgoing file ID (OFID), and outgoing group ID (OGID).

flowitems.name: Bulking Sending Time
flowitems.description: GPP invokes Bulking Sending Time rules to determine the appropriate time to generate and send outgoing files of payment messages. Each sending time defined in the Bulking profile must have a corresponding Bulking Sending Time rule.

flowitems.name: Posting (Individual Credit)
flowitems.description: GPP triggers the relevant interface to perform required posting.

flowitems.name: Out File Generation
flowitems.description: GPP routes all individual transactions to the Complete queue and creates the A message for file generation.

flowitems.name: Posting (Consolidated Credit)
flowitems.description: GPP triggers the relevant interface to perform required posting.

flowitems.name: Response Handling
flowitems.description: GPP matches the response to the file.
